alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 2:49PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding continues on the lower Susitna River and tributaries * WHERE...Including the following area, Yentna, Skwenta and Susitna Rivers. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. People should take immediate precautions for safety and to move threatened property to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM AKDT, Local observers along the Yentna, Skwentna and Lower Susitna Rivers continue to report high water and some flooding along the rivers. As of of Tuesday afternoon, over bank water depths along the Yentna River were still estimated between 1 and 3 feet, with flooding reported at cabins and outbuildings at numerous lodges. River levels are expected to crest over the next 12-24 hours. - Additional heavy rainfall is not expected in the basin overnight and the flood threat in the basin should start to diminish into Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to weather.gov/Anchorage, NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
